The Energy Storage Team at SFW had our annual spring gathering last month. The event more or less coincided with my 2-year work anniversary at SFW and was an opportunity to catch up with our team members who are spread out across multiple locations in different countries. The serene surroundings of the Nuuksio National Park (a short drive from our offices in Espoo) provided a perfect backdrop for our discussions. Nature-based activities and a team bbq lunch also provided opportunities for some relaxation and informal discussions with team members and colleagues who closely work with us from other departments. Some reflections after this gathering and after having completed 2 years with SFW and in Finland: üå° We had our gathering during a "heat wave" in Finland. Finland experienced a warmer than usual, dry May in 2024 with many parts of the country experiencing a higher number of days where the temperature exceeded 20 Celsius. While I am not an expert to draw a link to climate change, anecdotal evidence appears to suggest that these events are becoming commonplace, thereby increasing the urgent need to transition our energy systems as soon as possible. In some ways, being involved in the energy industry and commercializing solutions which can accelerate this transition indeed gives me a sense of greater purpose at work. ü§ù Importance of a positive work environment - a cursory glance at my LinkedIn profile will tell you that I have worked in some great organizations with fantastic teams. A common thread in most of my jobs was being part of a tight-knit team working more or less in a start-up mode. I have been lucky to avoid any "toxic" work environments in my career and SFW is absolutely a great place to work. Supportive team mates, empathy from the management and the highly flexible workplace make it easy for employees to enjoy a healthy working environment suited for the modern day workplace. While no company is perfect, the overall direction at SFW is oriented towards of becoming a great place to work. üë®üíº Being mentored and being a mentor - With the size of our team, I have had the chance to get mentored by some great colleagues with more years of experience. This is true especially in developing my softer skills such as being able to sell, market, talk with customers, work with other team mates and so on. As our team evolves and grows with an influx of young, talented and enthusiastic members, the opportunities to provide mentorship also grow and I have been able to reflect on my own experiences and share those with our new team members, hopefully speeding up their career development. All in all, it has been an exciting 2 years in a job which has given me a sense of purpose, great team mates and opportunities to grow. I look forward to growing the business, learning and sharing in the years to come, supported by an amazing team. #anniversary #ldes #workplace #purpose

This week was so intense, but so far productive in a same time. Even when I came back home from TRAKO, feeling sick and spending over a day in bed, it didn't stop me. I‚Äôm getting better now and I‚Äôm looking forward to continue some of fantastic discussions started this week in Gda≈Ñsk. During TRAKO POLAND I had the privilege of meeting so many fantastic people, engaging in great discussions about the current developments in the railway industry sector, and it was an absolute pleasure meeting many of you in person. I also had the opportunity to explore new technologies and learn more. During some interactions, I couldn't help but notice something important. Many individuals, despite having brilliant solutions, often followed their positive statements with a "BUT." They'd say, something like: "We have a great solution, BUT the market is not ready for that yet," or "We're too expensive." Let‚Äôs start doing it in the opposite way and say it something like that instead: ‚ÄúThe market is struggling with repeating the same things, BUT we have great solutions to fix that‚Äù. Remember, if you don't believe in yourself, don't expect others to believe in you either. Confidence in your vision and your ability to make it happen is the foundation for success. Embrace your ideas, stay committed, and watch how belief in yourself can move mountains! üí™üåü #BelieveInYourself #Confidence #NoExcuses #PositiveMindset #SuccessMindset #KeepGoing #EnablingFutureMobility

Empowering Minds, Breaking Barriers: The Role of Education in Africa and Beyond ‚ú®üåç As we navigate the complex landscape of education, let's take a moment to celebrate the unsung heroes - educators. They are the architects of dreams, shaping the future one lesson at a time. In my beloved Zambia and across Africa, education stands as a beacon of hope, yet inequalities persist. We must bridge the gap, ensuring every child has access to quality education, regardless of their background. Education is not just a privilege; it's a fundamental right. Global disparities further emphasize the need for a united effort. The transformative power of technology can play a pivotal role. Let's harness the potential of AI, VR, and other innovations to create inclusive learning environments. In doing so, we equip our youth with the tools to thrive in an ever-evolving world. As someone deeply passionate about education, I believe it's our collective responsibility to drive change. Let's foster collaboration, embrace technology, and empower educators to mold a future where education knows no bounds. #educationforall #inclusivefuture #edutech
